title: owncloud.com: PermError SPF Permanent Error: Too many DNS lookups

profile.name: ownCloud
profile.about: ownCloud GmbH is the company behind the ownCloud Project - the most downloaded open source project for data and file sync, share and view.

vulnerability_information:
I just checked for SPF records for the owncloud.com domain, and there are none, effectively allowing for spam(spoof) to originate from that domain. you can validate by testing yourself here: http://www.kitterman.com/spf/validate.html

SPF record lookup and validation for: owncloud.com

SPF records are published in DNS as TXT records.

The TXT records found for your domain are:
v=spf1 a:mx.owncloud.com a:kerio.owncloud.com a:schaltsekun.de a:m.hive01.com include:cmail1.com include:email.influitive.com include:google.com ~all 

Checking to see if there is a valid SPF record. 

Found v=spf1 record for owncloud.com: 
v=spf1 a:mx.owncloud.com a:kerio.owncloud.com a:schaltsekun.de a:m.hive01.com include:cmail1.com include:email.influitive.com include:google.com ~all 

evaluating...
Results - PermError SPF Permanent Error: Too many DNS lookups

activities.message:
Thanks. I can confirm this misconfiguration and will escalate this to our sysadmin team. At least I was not aware of this limitation.

However, please note that for the time being we do not award monetary rewards for bugs reported for our infrastructure. – We will however acknowledge this and mark this as valid bug.

From our FAQ:
> **Q: Why do you exclude the ownCloud websites?**
A: For the time being we want to focus our efforts on ownCloud Server instead of vulnerabilities within our website. However, if you find a security bug in our website we welcome any report, though we cannot offer a monetary incentive.
